SENT.plain: We report a series of 20 patients with the myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) each with a coexistent lymphoid or plasmacytic neoplasm
In none of the patients did chemotherapy play a part in the pathogenesis
The possible reasons for the coincidence of these conditions are discussed

The frequency and variety of associated neoplasms reinforces the idea that in MDS there are genetically unstable progenitor cells liable to clonal differentiation along a variety of pathways given appropriate stimuli
